title: High Financial Services Score
description: In 2024, Cambodia achieved a notable financial services score of 86.03, indicating a robust financial sector.

title: Strong Debt Policy Rating
description: Cambodia's debt policy was rated 5 out of 6 in 2023, reflecting a strong and effective debt management strategy.

title: High Women's Participation in Decision-Making
description: In 2022, 87.8% of Cambodian women aged 15-49 participated in key decision-making areas, showcasing gender inclusivity.

title: Low Net Acquisition of Financial Assets
description: In 2021, Cambodia's net acquisition of financial assets was -4.22 trillion LCU, indicating a significant financial outflow.

title: Limited Medium and High-Tech Manufacturing
description: In 2022, only 0.26% of Cambodia's manufacturing value added came from medium and high-tech sectors, highlighting a need for technological advancement.

title: Minimal Fuel Exports
description: Fuel exports accounted for a mere 0.00000339% of Cambodia's merchandise exports in 2022, indicating a negligible contribution from this sector.

title: Low Investment in Water and Sanitation
description: In 2023, Cambodia's investment in water and sanitation with private participation was just $2.3 million, suggesting limited infrastructure development.

title: Low Operational Efficiency in Business Entry
description: Cambodia scored 9 in the operational efficiency of business entry in 2024, indicating challenges in starting new businesses.

title: Weak Institutional Infrastructure for Insolvency
description: In 2024, Cambodia's quality of institutional and operational infrastructure for judicial insolvency proceedings was rated at 3.33, showing room for improvement.

title: Limited Public-Private Partnerships in Water and Sanitation
description: In 2022, public-private partnerships investment in water and sanitation was $7 million, indicating limited collaboration in this sector.
